meanings.definition: The advantages or benefits gained from a particular situation or course of action.
meanings.sent1: The wantages of studying hard include good grades and knowledge.
meanings.sent2: She carefully considered the wantages of accepting the job offer.
meanings.sent3: The wantages of eating ice cream for breakfast are questionable.
meanings.sent4: The wantages of kindness can brighten someone's day.
meanings.sent5: He weighed the wantages of going to the party versus staying home to study.

meanings.definition: The act of gaining an advantage or benefit.
meanings.sent1: Her wantages in negotiations helped her secure a better deal.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated their wantages in the game with high-fives.
meanings.sent3: His wantages in hide-and-seek were unmatched by anyone in the group.
meanings.sent4: The wantages of teamwork were evident in their successful project completion.
meanings.sent5: She utilized her wantages to excel in the competition.
